p:
Supercritical carbon dioxide (SC-CO 2) injection into gas reservoirs is considered to be a promising technology that will bring long-term mutual benefits for coupled increased productivity and CO 2 geosequestration
3– 12 . CO 2 Enhanced Gas Recovery (EGR) has been studied in laboratory settings and in field-scale simulations for both tight and conventional gas reservoirs, but application in the field remains limited to a handful of cases
13– 16 .
